文献ID: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_025_chunk1
证据片段: During high-temperature transients on Zircaloy-clad nuclear fuel rods, both external and internal cladding oxidation have been observed. The result of such oxidation is to embrittle the cladding, making it susceptible to brittle fracture.

文献ID: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_025_chunk1
证据片段: External oxidation of Zircaloy in a steam environment is relatively well understood

文献ID: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_025_chunk1
证据片段: oxygen-induced $\beta \to \alpha$ phase transformation occurs in Zircaloy at elevated temperatures

文献ID: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_025_chunk1
证据片段: Out-of-pile experiments have also been performed by Hofmann [3] in Zircaloy-4 tube specimens filled with stoichiometric high-density uranium dioxide and placed in an annealing furnace kept at constant temperature ranging from 1000 to $1 4 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ up to times of $^ { 1 \ h }$ .

证据片段: At $1 0 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathbf { C }$ , uranium dioxide is reduced by zirconium so that a uranium dioxide oxygen-stabilized $\pmb { \alpha }$ -zirconium solid mixture forms, which includes some $\pmb { \gamma }$ -uranium and $\beta$ -zirconium.
